content.description: Super fun!  East face between the two boulders - don't use the left side arete. Sit start on lower right side of east face on crimp rail.  Pull cool moves on gorgeous crimps up and left into center of face and into Bicuspid Helicoprion.  Same finish as Bicuspid Helicoprion.
content.protection: Big crash pad and good spotter.

content.description: Starting on the short overhanging face compressing the bottom of the left arete on a good bump, right hand in the incut crimp on the top of the flake/block feature. Move up compressing the left arete and edges/slopers to the right. Topout is easy but tall.
content.location:
From the two main cherry boulders (holding busch league and perplexed leprechaun) walk up the hill directly behind the boulders (south) until you come to a talus field. Walk to the top left of the field to the obvious large pointed boulder.

Coordinates: 41.923545, -111.735778

content.description: Starts the same as Compressed Leprechaun in the chalky flake/crack. Trends up and right on perfect flat crimps, then moves to the lip to a good blocky hold. From there work up and right up the slanted sloping lip on bad holds to merge into Beyond Ripe. Tops out the same as Beyond Ripe, right of the apex.
content.protection: Bring pads, plus a spotter or some huevos
content.location: Start as for Compressed Leprechaun, tops out on Beyond Ripe, trending up and right across the face.

content.description: Starts under the little prow on left facing sidepulls. Goes straight up on compression holds to an easy but fairly high topout.
content.location: Just to right of Air Freshener under the little overhanging prow.

content.description: Starts on the South East corner on two obvious low sidepull slopers. Use only slopers up to the first shelf.
Sit start on crimp and triangular hold. Move up to one crimp, then another smaller one. Move left to full pad crimp. Top out to jug.
Start in the thin crack moving up then left to pull the roof.
content.location: On the west side of the first boulder on your right. Under the roof. Same boulder as Monkey Hug.

content.description: Facing the main face, start on the lower left corner in large pocket. Move up then to the right traversing on sloper rails into technical crux on the arete. Top out on bomber holds.
content.location: On the main boulder. Starting at the boulder for Monkey hug, bush wack back down the canyon about 50 yards.

content.description: East face between the two boulders-- don't use the left side arete. Starts on a white two-hand bomber hold.
content.protection: Big crash pad and a good spotter.
content.location: From the trail head, walk up trail about 1/2 a mile or 8-10 minutes. Pass the first big boulder on your right. It will be the obvious shark tooth looking boulder on your left.

content.description: Stand start about 4 feet off the ground with left hand good sloper ledge and right hand crimp sidepull. Use sweet thin holds to go straight up the mostly blank face with the clear sidepull crimp in the center. Make a big committing reach to the lip to find a good hold to topout on. Techy, sweet holds, full value finish, yes.
content.protection: A pad or two. Nice to have a spotter for committing finish
content.location: On the same boulder as Monkey Hug and Compressed Leprechaun. Located on the south side facing away from the trail on the clean light face.

content.description:
Start on a flat left hand crimp far out left and a juggy side pull. Move up and right to a slopey rail and some crimps. Finish up and right of the apex. Great movement to slightly than positive holds.

Gets some nice sun a little after noon
content.location: First significant boulder you see walking into cherry creek. Down and to the right sitting in the riverbed.
